reviews.review_msg: SO incredibly helpful - and perfectly clear in her expectations, critiques, etc. I have never had a prof care so much about my personal improvement! I became a MUCH stronger writer because of Sasha Colby!!

Super professor. So enthusiastic, so interesting, pretty funny too. She is my fav prof so far at SFU. She speaks very eloquently and this makes her very understandable because she is able to say precisely what students need to hear to understand material. She will teach you many very useful skills. I quickly signed up for another of her classes!

A bit of an airhead, but in a good way. Very artsy and creative, recognizes ingenuity in projects. A bit too politically vocal for an English prof (leftist of some sort) inserting her opinions on topical affairs into relation to  the course in a didactic manner.

Interesting and entertaining professor. One must keep up with the readings to fully appreciate the course. It is much like an english course, quite writing intensive, so beware! She seems to be genuinely interested in helping her students improve as writers. Approachable within tutorial and office hours. Overall, good professor for an okay course.

Sasha is great, her feedback on your work is REALLY helpful and she genuinely cares about her students. Creative and fun, but heck, if lectures get a little long, you can always comment on her outfits ;)
The course is basically like an english course. marking is a little harsh. Gets annoying at times. the course content is somewhat interesting. i would she is very understanding.
